name: TheAtlantic
text: Every American's pandemic situation is different, but one basic rule could keep us all safer, @rachgutman writes. https://t.co/JPujMamwDh

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The Shelton nomination looks like McConnell’s bid to add a pro-recession bias to the Biden-era Fed," writes @davidfrum: https://t.co/yt3gXw6FHv

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Getting in the way of the obvious public-health move is the reality that the federal government has done nothing—a miserable, unforgivable, death-and-destruction-inducing nothing—since the spring," @AnnieLowrey writes: https://t.co/mK0Rh7P3Wj

name: TheAtlantic
text: In Asia, Barack Obama left a complicated legacy. It is one that Joe Biden must now grapple with, @TMcLaughlin3 writes: https://t.co/X1jPhmsgw6

name: TheAtlantic
text: The recent backlash to the Kardashians shows how the coronavirus pandemic has—for now, at least—rendered their class of celebrities obsolete, @skornhaber writes: https://t.co/HHW24i0nOt

name: TheAtlantic
text: New data from the federal government makes it clear: Hospitals are filling up, writes @alexismadrigal, and they are running out of the staff they need to take care of patients. https://t.co/jap2QrfXuN

name: TheAtlantic
text: One week ago, the president of Azerbaijan and the prime minister of Armenia signed a Russian-brokered ceasefire agreement that ended six weeks of warfare over disputed territory. Photos of the 2020 Nagorno-Karabakh War, via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/UwvI1zw9q9 https://t.co/djb3VTCb7p

name: TheAtlantic
text: Read our December 2020 cover story by @SarahZhang: The Last Children of Down Syndrome. https://t.co/03N0q0sGSB https://t.co/Qow48LH6um

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @anneapplebaum: The world is not the same as it was in 2016. Nobody should imagine that Biden will bring about a restoration. To succeed, his administration will have to carry out a revolution.  https://t.co/w5iwmeCn5G

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Some on the Biden team, veterans of the Obama administration, will be tempted to restart relationships and reboot old plans as if nothing has happened. That would be a mistake," @anneapplebaum writes: https://t.co/6nQm4EHEtu

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @sarahzhang: 1/ Hello, I have a story I've been working on for a long time—long before there was a pandemic, if you can believe it. It’s about the past and future of our children’s DNA. 

My cover story for @TheAtlantic: 

https://t.co/3eibCOW19K

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump's complaints about a rigged election are baseless and dangerous … but they are especially ironic because the American electoral system outperformed expectations despite the most challenging circumstances in recent memory," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/EX0b1Tihth

name: TheAtlantic
text: Many people have tested positive for antibodies without ever getting COVID-19. But this doesn’t mean they’re immune to the virus, writes @JamesHamblin: https://t.co/qk3dbJyNpX

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @olgakhazan: The news about the at-home Lucira test is encouraging, but experts call it a "baby step." Why? It's expensive and you need a prescription. Some, like @michaelmina_lab, say the government needs to send bags of cheap, at-home COVID-19 tests to every American https://t.co/nQ1ejejGvb

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @realcpaz: The president continues to undermine trust in our elections. It might not hurt him too much in the long run, but there are some lessons from our southern neighbor about how it will damage our democracy for years to come.

https://t.co/kfrSTOTvaa

name: TheAtlantic
text: Mexico's president hasn't recognized Joe Biden as America's president-elect. But AMLO is offering a lesson about when to concede elections, @realcpaz reports: https://t.co/g3khTPaCm7

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: Our newest cover story, by @sarahzhang, is extraordinary. It takes rare talent to take on questions of such complexity with this degree of grace and brilliance. https://t.co/2GbW63cfhp

name: TheAtlantic
text: “The only reason that we don’t have these out in massive numbers is that the federal government hasn’t prioritized it in any way,” Michael Mina, a Harvard epidemiologist and proponent of at-home tests, told @olgakhazan: https://t.co/KQ4JL6PnZE

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Few people speak publicly about wanting to ‘eliminate’ Down syndrome,” @sarahzhang writes. “Yet individual choices are adding up to something very close to that.” https://t.co/4rfCAaqWtG

name: TheAtlantic
text: The picture is grim as is. Please consider canceling your holiday plans. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/pveoVYHoEo

name: TheAtlantic
text: "No American figure has wrestled with the contest between idealism and realism as publicly as Barack Obama. His new memoir, 'A Promised Land,' can be read as a long dialogue between these opposing visions," @nytdavidbrooks writes. https://t.co/MC6lGLwEDK

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @slaskow: "The most tenuous moment is over: The scientific uncertainty at the heart of COVID-19 vaccines is resolved." 

https://t.co/rOHRDRvlxz
